sentences.en: "Forgive my manners," she said calmly. "I neglected to introduce myself."
sentences.cn: “请原谅我礼数不周，”她平静地说。“我忘了自我介绍了。”

sentences.en: Forgive me, I don't mean to insult you.
sentences.cn: 请原谅，我并非有意侮辱你。

sentences.en: Forgive me. I shouldn't be jumping to conclusions.
sentences.cn: 原谅我，我不该草率地下结论。

sentences.en: Forgive my asking, but you're not very happy, are you?
sentences.cn: 恕我冒昧，你不太高兴，是吗？

sentences.en: He didn’t look the sort of man to forgive and forget (= forgive someone and no longer think about it ) .
sentences.cn: 他看上去不是那种不记仇的人。

sentences.en: I can never, ever forgive him. I despise him.
sentences.cn: 我永远不会原谅他。我鄙视他。

sentences.en: I can never, ever, forgive myself.
sentences.cn: 我永远无法原谅我自己。

sentences.en: I can't forgive Lewis for robbing me of an Olympic gold.
sentences.cn: 我不能原谅刘易斯夺走了我一块奥运会金牌。

sentences.en: I do hope you'll forgive me but I've got to leave.
sentences.cn: 我真的非常抱歉，我得走了。

sentences.en: She was angry at Steve's rudeness, but I could forgive it.
sentences.cn: 她对史蒂夫的无礼非常生气，但是我可以原谅这一点。

sentences.en: She was instantly contrite. "Oh, I am sorry! You must forgive me."
sentences.cn: 她马上就懊悔了。“哦，我很抱歉！你一定要原谅我。”

sentences.en: Those around her would forgive her for weeping.
sentences.cn: 她身边的人会原谅她掉眼泪的。

sentences.en: with the plaster palm trees, you could be forgiven for thinking you were somewhere on Hollywood Boulevard.
sentences.cn: 有那么多石膏棕榈树，即使你误以为你是走在好莱坞大道上也是可以理解的。

sentences.en: Would they forgive and forget — or show him the door?
sentences.cn: 他们会既往不咎吗——还是会对他下逐客令呢？

sentences.en: You're going to have to forgive my pronunciation.

phrases.phrase: one could (或 may) be forgiven for doing something

phrases.tran_cn: 请原谅我；请你谅解我吧

trans.tran_en: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong
to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong
